glsa.title: Sylpheed, Sylpheed-claws: Message reply overflow
glsa.synopsis: Sylpheed and Sylpheed-claws contain a vulnerability that can be triggered when replying to specially crafted messages.

background.p: Sylpheed is a lightweight email client and newsreader. Sylpheed-claws is a 'bleeding edge' version of Sylpheed.

description.p: Sylpheed and Sylpheed-claws fail to properly handle non-ASCII characters in email headers when composing reply messages.

impact.p: An attacker can send an email containing a malicious non-ASCII header which, when replied to, would cause the program to crash, potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the software.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
